data.title: John Francis Roman on LinkedIn: Hometown kid making good.
data.text:
You know when you're scrolling & you see a video or photo by someone you're a big fan of & you know before checking that it was theirs? That's simply because they have developed their own unique style - or brand My latest YouTube video delves into this further, giving you advice about achieving this successfully for yourself as a filmmaker! Find it here: https://lnkd.in/dBZw4PvZ #filmmaker #tips #youtube #video #new #style

These videos are usually engaging and full of energy, which is great because these edits grab the viewer's attention and keep them glued to the screen. I love it when one cool cinematic title after another pops up with a powerful message. It's like those styles we see in movie trailers‚Äîsuch a smart way to get messages across to people. The idea is to build trust in the product, explain how it benefits them, and much more. So, for this edit, every editor needs info about the course and the person guiding them. Include stuff about SocialProfs, testimonials from past customers, and other details about the project. Special thanks to Ryan John Collins for sharing that project with me! üíùüíù... #videoediting #cinematic #coursecreation #SocialProfs #Testimonials #CreativeCollaboration #videoeditors #videoads #tradingstrategies

Abstract thinking is sometimes directly proportional to aptitude thinking. There is a course called "How to Master the Art of Filmmaking" by Dan Mace. Dan Mace is the Chief Creative Officer for Mr. Beast. I was scrolling through Instagram and saw that everyone was talking about this course. When I looked into what the course covers, I found it substantial enough to consider enrolling. The course discusses the three stages of video production: pre-production, production (shooting), and post-production. For someone like me who is already familiar with some elements of filmmaking, I found the pre-production session particularly interesting. However, the other parts also have streamlined content that is worth spending time on. Link: https://lnkd.in/gzp5tg6X This is not a promotion, but if anyone would like to upgrade even a step more in the field of video production, this course is for them, just like it is for. me and It's free! #Happylearning #lovefilmmaking #newskills

Looking for the perfect place to film your next video? Look no further than your own car! According to recent reports, filming in your car can provide great lighting during the day, as well as excellent noise canceling and privacy. Don't have a fancy studio to work with? No problem! Try filming in your car and see the difference it can make. #filmingtips #videoproduction #contentcreation

How to Choose What Movie to Watch Next Sometimes it's relaxing to search through thousands of movies to choose the one you want to watch, but little by little this can become a frustrating task. People all over the internet have shared tips and tricks they use when choosing a movie is hard for them, and we at "How To Learn Tricks" have picked the handiest to help you narrow down your list. 1. Choose according to plots and actors. 2. Choose a genre according to your mood. 3. Check both audience and critics‚Äô ratings. 4. Check your watch list. 5. Go for a random movie. 6. Decide after watching the trailer. #howto #choose #movie #watch #next #animation #animatedmovies #hollywood #hollywoodmovies #plotactors #audience #watchlist #randommovie #actresses #actress #actors
